For each temporary oil or potion you brew during your daily preparations, you brew two copies of it. This allows you to brew two temporary oils or potions each day, four if you have master proficiency in spell DC, or six if you have legendary proficiency.

Activate—Diplomat's Bearing A (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

You fire a shard of solidified magic toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of shards you shoot by one, to a maximum of three shards for 3 actions. You choose the target for each shard individually. If you shoot more than one shard at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

Heightened (+2) You fire one additional shard with each action you spend.

You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} a temporary item out of anything, anywhere, with whatever materials happen to be on hand, spending only 10 minutes to perform the initial Crafting check.

The temporary item must be one you've memorized or have the formula for, and must be common, non-magical, half your level or lower, and must be a weapon, armor, or a non-consumable piece of adventuring gear (non-consumable adventuring gear appears on page 291 of Player Core). Instead of a single item, you can create 10 pieces of a single type of ammunition. You can create only the physical item, not any information or magic, so for example, while you could create a blank journal or one with random pages, you couldn't use it as a scholarly journal or a religious text

Before you even started adventuring, you had money

to spare. Now, you can put that fabulous wealth to good

use while you travel the world. Each morning, during your

preparations, you set aside a stipend for yourself and your

allies. Your stipend makes life easier without allowing you to

spend all of your capital at once.

Spare Change: You always have spare currency enough

to afford basic services and consumables. At 1st level, this

includes up to a private room (for 2) and 2 square meals

with accompanying drinks (ale, coffee, or tea). You can

spend your entire week’s worth of this spare currency to

instead get an extravagant suite (for 6) for one night with

enough left over to afford 6 square meals and stabling for

up to 6 creatures.

Comfortable Living: When in your home country or any

country allied with your own, you can maintain a comfortable

standard of living. You can extend this benefit to up to one

of your allies plus one ally per 5 levels. If you want, you can

double the number of allies by choosing to subsist instead.

Halve this number when outside of a friendly country.

Activate A (manipulate)

An invisibility potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.GNMy7NYfF3AQwHpN]{Divine Health}

You gain a +1 status bonus to saves against diseases and poisons.

If you are already wearing light armor, increase the armor’s 
bonus to your Armor Class by 1 point.

At 5th level, you can create a suit of any common 
medium armor instead, affecting you in the same 
way as light ice armor.

You possess more knowledge than you can directly

apply on a daily basis. You gain a lesson guide and

the Train Ally activity. Your lesson guide stores

knowledge of feat-based abilities much like a wizard’s

spellbook stores spells.

Your lesson guide begins with all the feats you currently

have, plus two common feats of each level

up to your level. (So, if you are 4th level when you

take this feat, your lesson guide contains 2 1st-level

feats, 2 2nd-level feats, 2 3rd-level feats, and 2 4thlevel

feats.) Whenever you gain a feat (whether

through increasing your level or through retraining),

you automatically add it to your lesson guide, and

when you gain a level, you add two common feats

of that level to your lesson guide. You can use the

retraining activity to add a feat to your lesson

guide without replacing one of your current feats. If

you ever lose your lesson guide, you can spend 8

hours recreating it, but the new lesson guide includes

only the feats you have at that time.

TTRAIN ALLY

CONCENTRATE EXPLORATION LINGUISTIC

Target one willing ally or yourself

You and the target spend one hour in intensive

training. This target is designated as your trainee.

This activity requires that you have access to your

lesson guide, and usually requires sufficient space

for your training session. At the end of this activity,

choose one feat from your lesson guide for which

the target meets the prerequisites (other than ancestry,

archetype, or class) and which the target

could reasonably retrain into following the usual

guidelines. (For example, you cannot use Train Ally

to give a human claws or darkvision.) The chosen

feat is the target’s temporary feat. The target gains

the temporary feat until their next daily preparations,

until they fall unconscious, or until you target

them with this activity again (whichever comes

first).

You can have any number of trainees at a time,

but you must spend an hour using this activity with

each of them individually.

Mutual learning: Teaching someone = 1 trainee feats to my lesson guide.

Timely feedback: When a trainee uses a temporary feat: reaction to give a +1 to an action involving the feat.

Crossless studies: Switch between allies: Number of temporary feats up to half your level rounded up.

You push into the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals 1d6 mental damage, with a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.
You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and @Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,mental]] damage. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. If the target recovers from being Sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.

You cause the target to see all other creatures as dire threats. The target is stricken by intense paranoia toward all creatures around it and must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target believes everyone it sees is a potential threat. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} to all creatures to which it wasn't already hostile, even those that were previously allies. It treats no one as an ally. The spell ends after 1 round.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target believes that everyone it sees is a mortal enemy. It uses its reactions and free actions against everyone, regardless of whether they were previously its allies, as determined by the GM. It otherwise acts as rationally as it normally does and likely prefers to attack creatures that are actively attacking or hindering it over those leaving it alone.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to 5 creatures.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
